strapiPost.title: FPL to Host Inaugural NWA Maker Faire
strapiPost.content:
The inaugural NWA Maker Faire is Saturday, October 8, at the Fayetteville Public Library from 9-5p, with plenty of hands-on activities and interactive experiences to go around!

  • Bringing curiosity to life: The Maker Faire is a family-friendly showcase of invention, creativity, and resourcefulness. It’s a gathering of engineers, artists, scientists, and crafters who love sharing what they do to produce “The Greatest Show (& Tell) on Earth.”
  • What to expect: Participants from the FPL’s From Maker to Market program will be selling wares at the vendor market, which is free and open to the public. At the Faire, there will be a soldering activity, giant ridable rocking horses, a hands-on Kitbashing workshop, children’s activities, and more. 

Learn more HERE.
